docs.text:
Introduction


These are the specifications developed by the 
Local Waste Service Standards Project
.


Design principles


The Government Service Design Manual 
guidelines for APIs
 will be used.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: These are the specifications developed by the  Local Waste Service Standards Project .
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: The Government Service Design Manual  guidelines for APIs  will be used.
docs.title: Design principles

docs.text:
Data models


This gives an overview of the data models:








Model


Description










Service


A waste or recycling service provided by the council for citizens.






Round plan


A truck collecting one or more material streams from a set of containers on a repeating schedule.






Round


An instance of a round plan that has been executed on a particular date.






Event


An issue or check that is recorded during a round.






Container


Where materials are stored for collection.






Material stream


The types of materials that can be collected.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: This gives an overview of the data models:     Model  Description      Service  A waste or recycling service provided by the council for citizens.    Round plan  A truck collecting one or more material streams from a set of containers on a repeating schedule.    Round  An instance of a round plan that has been executed on a particular date.    Event  An issue or check that is recorded during a round.    Container  Where materials are stored for collection.    Material stream  The types of materials that can be collected.
docs.title: Data models

docs.text:
Service


Use cases and requirements


The Service model should have properties for:


name




For identification.




frequency




An indication of typically how often the collection is run.




description




For specific instructions about the service, such as when and where to put containers out, that bin lids must be closed, etc.




next collections




To know upcoming dates of when upcoming collections will happen, when filtered by property.




previous collections




To know when the last few collections have taken place, when filtered by property.




material stream




What kinds of materials are handled by this service.




rounds




The schedules and routes of trucks collecting the materials handled by this service.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










name


Text


Name of the service.






frequency


Text


How often it runs, e.g. weekly.






description


schema:description


A short description of the service.






next collections


Date


List of dates of next collections.






previous collections


Date


List of dates of previous collections.






material stream


?


The material stream that is collected.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Recycling service",
  "frequency": "weekly",
  "esd_url": "http://id.esd.org.uk/service/1130",
  "description": "Please put your recycling box on the street."
}

    

  






Codelists


Freqency


TBD

The material stream that is collected.

docs.title: Codelists

docs.text:
Round plan


Use cases and requirements


The Round model should have properties for:


date




When this round took place.




round plan




A reference to which Round plan was used.




events




Any related events that have been recorded.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@id": "/rounds/456",
  "date": "",
  "plan": {
    "id": "",
    "start_date": "",
    "rrule": "",
    "containers": "/api/containers?round_plan=1"
  },
  "events": "/api/events?round=456"
}
docs.title: Round

docs.text: The Round model should have properties for:  date   When this round took place.   round plan   A reference to which Round plan was used.   events   Any related events that have been recorded.

Round plan


Use cases and requirements


The Round plan model should have properties for:


containers




What properties the round will collect from.




start date




When rule starts.




repeating rule




How often the round is run.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "id": "",
  "start_date": "",
  "rrule": "",
  "containers": "/api/containers?round_plan=1"
}

docs.text:
Container


Use cases and requirements


The Container model should have properties for:


container type




For the common properties of the container.




serial number or ID




For identification of the container.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










id




Unique identifer.






type




The type of container.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{

}

Serialisation

docs.text:
Container type


Use cases and requirements


The Container type model should have properties for:


color




The general color.




size




Typically in litres.




shape




Wheelie bin, box, caddy, etc.




lid color




In case its different to the body color.




material stream




What kind of waste the container is used for.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










id




Unique identifer.






color


schema:color


General color as a hex value.






size


integer


Size in litres.






shape


text


The shape or type of the container.






lid color


schema:color


Lid-specific color as a hex value.






material stream












Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "color": "#fff",
  "shape": "wheelie bin",
  "size": "240",

}

    









Codelists


Container shape

docs.title: Codelists

docs.text:
Event


Use cases and requirements


The Event model should have properties for:


event type




What kind of event it is.




date created




Know when an event happened.




UPRN




For recording against specific properties.




USRN




For recording street-level events.




coordinates




For easy geolocation of where the event was recorded.




image




Visual evidence of an issue.




comments




For any additional information useful to record.




round




The round where this event happened.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










type


string


A categorisation of the event.






date created


string


When the event was created.






uprn


string


A unique identifier for a property.






usrn


string


A unique identifier for a street.






geo


schema:geo


The location in WGS84 datum.






image


schema:image


A URL to a related image.






round


URL


The URL of the round where this event was recorded.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@id": "/api/events/1",
  "type": "Not presented",
  "date_created": "2014-05-23T20:00",
  "uprn": "123456789012",
  "usrn": "123456789012",
  "image": "http://example.com/images/123.png",
  "geo": {
    "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
    "latitude": "40.75",
    "longitude": "73.98"
  },
  "round": "/rounds/123"
}
docs.title: Event

USRN   For recording street-level events.   coordinates   For easy geolocation of where the event was recorded.   image   Visual evidence of an issue.   comments   For any additional information useful to record.   round   The round where this event happened.

string

docs.text:
Missed collections reasons


The table below lists a set of common possible events that can occur during a waste collection round.


Many council classifications also divide event types by the service or container type. It is assumed here that it will be possible to categorise the events by:




service type


property or street









  
ID

  
Name

  
Type

  
Description

  
Synonyms






  

  
Not presented

  
service

  
The container was not presented on the street.

  
Non-Presentation






  

  
Incorrectly presented

  
service

  

  






  

  
Too heavy

  
service

  
The container was too heavy to empty.

  
Overweight Bin






  

  
Lid open

  
service

  
The container was too full, the lid would not close properly.

  
Overflowing Bin / Lid up






  

  
Side waste present

  
service

  
Extra refuse was present at the side of the bins.

  
Sidewaste






  

  
Contamination

  
service

  
The contents was contaminated.

  






  

  
Inaccessible container store

  
service

  
It was not possible to access the bins.

  
Inaccessible Bin Store






  

  
Container damaged

  
service

  
A bin was damaged.

  
Bin damaged






  

  
Container lost in vehicle

  
service

  
A bin was lost inside the vehicle.

  
Receptacle Lost in Vehicle






  

  
Not on scheme

  
service

  
The property was not on the service.

  






  

  
Inaccessible road

  
service

  
The road could not be accessed.

  






  

  
Road closure

  
service

  
The road was closed.

  






  

  
Querying assisted

  
service

  

  






  

  
Street completed

  
general

  

  






  

  
Blocked by vehicles

  
general

  

  






  

  
Road works

  
general

  

  






  

  
Gate locked

  
general

  

  






  

  
Part access

  
general

  

  






  

  
Partly completed street

  
general

  

  






  

  
Alarm activated

  
general

  

  






  

  
Breakdown

  
general

docs.title: Material streams

docs.text:
Waste Services API


Introduction


This API offers a core set of resources and operations for interacting with local council waste and recycling services.


ESD Standards


The 
ESD Standards
 define all the categories of services that local authorities typically provide. These will be referenced via URL from the Services API, to allow individual council instances of a service to be matched to common service definitions.


Services




Get a list of waste services



  
get

  
/services





Response


[
  {
    
id
: 1,
    
name
: 
Recycling service
,
    
frequency
: 
weekly
,
    
esd_url
: 
http://id.esd.org.uk/service/524
,
    
description
: 
Please put your recycling box on the street.

  },
  {
    
id
: 2,
    
name
: 
Refuse
,
    
frequency
: 
weekly
,
    
esd_url
: 
http://id.esd.org.uk/service/525
,
    
description
: 
Black bins.

  }
]

Events




Get a list of events



  
get

  
/events





Query parameters








Name


Type


Description










page


number








uprn


string


Limit results to those related to the property with this UPRN.






usrn


string


Limit results to those related to the street with this USRN.






type


string


Limit results to those with a matching type, e.g. "Not presented".






start_date


date


Limit results to those created on or after this start date.






end_date


date


Limit results to those created before this end date.






round


string


Limit results to those recorded against this round.

docs.title: API

docs.text: This API offers a core set of resources and operations for interacting with local council waste and recycling services.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: The  ESD Standards  define all the categories of services that local authorities typically provide. These will be referenced via URL from the Services API, to allow individual council instances of a service to be matched to common service definitions.
docs.title: ESD Standards

docs.text:
Get a list of waste services  
   get 
   /services   Response  [
  {
     id : 1,
     name :  Recycling service ,
     frequency :  weekly ,
     esd_url :  http://id.esd.org.uk/service/524 ,
     description :  Please put your recycling box on the street. 
  },
  {
     id : 2,
     name :  Refuse ,
     frequency :  weekly ,
     esd_url :  http://id.esd.org.uk/service/525 ,
     description :  Black bins. 
  }
]   Get a single service  
   get 
   /services/{serviceId}   Response  {
   id : 1,
   name :  Recycling service ,
   frequency :  weekly ,
   esd_url :  http://id.esd.org.uk/service/1130 ,
   description :  Please put your recycling box on the street. 
}
